page.title: 02LARGE HOUSES IN THE BLOCK
page.content: WEST HALL Built in the l5th Century. A two storey house with attic constructed of rubble walls and a stone slate roof. Originally it was a Manor House, today it is a working farmhouse. FOLKE MANOR Built in the late l5th Century or early l6th Century with rubble walls and slate roof. Two stories plus attic and was added to in the l7th Century. A farm until l985, it is now a private home. FONT LE ROI Of Medieval origin. Originally a gatehouse, the north east wing consisting of farm buildings - it has been much altered. It was a Manor House, then a farm and currently it is for sale. MARSH COURT The nucleus was built in the l8th Cent
